content: रजस् {%<ab>n.</ab>%} [रंज्-असुन् नलोपः] {@--1@} Dust, powder, dirt; धन्यास्तदंगरजसां मलिनीभवंति <ls>Ś. 7. 17</ls>; आत्मोद्धतैरपि रजोभिरलंघनीयाः <ls n="Ś.">1. 8</ls>; <ls>R. 1. 42</ls>; <ls n="R.">6. 33.</ls> {@--2@} The dust or pollen of flowers; भूयात्कुशेशयरजोमृदुरेणुरस्याः (पंथाः) <ls>Ś. 4. 10</ls>; <ls>Me. 33</ls>, <ls n="Me.">65.</ls> {@--3@} A mote in a sun-beam, any small particle (of matter); <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>Ms. 8. 132</ls> and <ls>Y. 1. 362.</ls> {@--4@} A ploughed or cultivated land, arable field. {@--5@} Gloom, darkness. {@--6@} Foulness, passion, emotion, moral or mental darkness; अपथे पदमर्पयंति हि श्रुतवंतोऽपि रजोनिमीलिताः <ls>R. 9. 74.</ls> {@--7@} The second of the three Guṇas or constituent qualities of all material substances (the other two being सत्त्व and तमस्; रजस् is supposed to be the cause of the great activity seen in creatures; it predominates in men, as {%Sattva%} and {%Tamas%} predominate in gods and demons); अंतर्गतमपास्तं मे रजसोपि परं तमः <ls>Ku. 6. 60</ls>; <ls>Bg. 6. 27</ls>; रजोजुषे जन्मनि <ls>K.</ls>; <ls>Māl. 1. 20.</ls> {@--8@} Menstrual discharge, menses; <ls>Ms. 4. 41</ls>; <ls n="Ms.">5. 66.</ls> {@--9@} Safflower. {@--10@} Tin. {@--11@} <ab>Ved.</ab> Air, atmosphere. {@--12@} A division of the world. {@--13@} Vapour. {@--14@} Cloud or rain-water.
